tweets.text: At Mayor’s Question Time today I paid tribute to the victims of the Westminster terrorist attack, and the bravery of our emergency services and first responders who ran towards danger while urging others to run to safety. #LondonUnited #MQT https://t.co/nMXJjWHLnx
I'll shortly be answering questions from the @LondonAssembly on the issues affecting London. Watch Mayor's Question Time live. #MQT https://t.co/zfRhhMypLB
Today we pay tribute to PC Keith Palmer, Kurt Cochran, Andreea Cristea, Aysha Frade and Leslie Rhodes. We stand with their loved ones in remembrance and solidarity. #LondonUnited

We will never forget the innocent lives lost in the horrific terror attacks on our city in 2017, nor the bravery of our emergency services and first responders who ran towards danger while urging the rest of us to run to safety. #LondonUnited https://t.co/nASI58Y5Zo

Tonight at City Hall we recognised the contribution Chinese businesses and the thriving Chinese community make to London. As Mayor I’m committed to strengthening trade and cultural links with China – a vital relationship after Brexit. #LondonIsOpen https://t.co/5EoGhoJo2V

Sport has an incredible power to bring people together and to break down barriers. Proud to announce our new fund for grassroots community sports in London: https://t.co/9hJwUqHFJv https://t.co/7XjoJ36faT

.@TfL's new competition to encourage children to think about the different roles women play in keeping London moving is a fantastic way to celebrate the integral work they do, and inspire our next generation. #BehindEveryGreatCity https://t.co/rvL6Lu6lV3
It’s no secret that London has long needed more river crossings in the east. Pleased to see strong public support for a new pedestrian and cycling crossing at Rotherhithe. https://t.co/CIuMu0aA7q

I’m passionate about grassroots sport and its incredible power to unite people from different backgrounds. The £3m funding we’ve announced today, in partnership with @sportrelief, will help bring Londoners from diverse communities closer together. Apply: https://t.co/wjXZMX53y9 https://t.co/3XMMVqQzXA

Tomorrow, 22nd March, marks one year since the tragic terrorist attack at Westminster. We will be coming together at City Hall to show support and create a tribute to all of those affected. Stand with us and share your message of hope and unity to the city with #LondonUnited https://t.co/iU0pPOdXoj

We know thousands of people have been deeply affected by these attacks. If you have suggestions for how we can recognise and remember the events of last summer, or if you need support, please get in touch: https://t.co/OdkPF72k23

Today we have announced plans to mark the anniversaries of the four terrorist attacks in London last year. Over the coming days, weeks and months we’re asking Londoners, and people around the world, to stand in solidarity with our city. #LondonUnited https://t.co/FHPTaQ0rGC

Congratulations to the eleven London boroughs shortlisted to become the UK’s first Creative Enterprise Zones, making it easier for artists and creative businesses to put down roots in the capital. 

Read more: https://t.co/YuqGrKFQ4G

Prevention is the most effective tool we have for tackling knife crime. Today we’re announcing nine community projects that will receive a share of £250,000 from City Hall, supporting young Londoners to turn away from crime and fulfil their potential. https://t.co/e7VHnL6IaB https://t.co/2Gv1YcF9Z1

Very pleased to announce Claire Pritchard as the new Chair of the London Food Board, which offers vital support to London’s growers, producers and retailers. Looking forward to working with Claire and to the important work of the Board under her leadership https://t.co/yUEQzXlqIz https://t.co/oZ6e16yx6Q

In the past six months @TfL has installed 100 rapid charge points for electric vehicles. This is a big step forward in the shift towards zero-emission vehicles, which the capital desperately needs to clean up our toxic air. #cleanair https://t.co/pCOyJPbZIt https://t.co/L6F2KhVuaA

At City Hall we must do everything in our power to address the gender pay gap. Data published today highlights that there is still much more to do to ensure more women in senior leadership roles https://t.co/MN1q3OSTWq

In the past six months @TfL has installed 100 rapid charge points, where electric cars can be charged in as little as 30 minutes. This is a big step forward in the shift towards zero-emission vehicles - but we need boroughs to do more https://t.co/pCOyJPbZIt https://t.co/DfSRZb6yUq

Incredibly proud to join thousands of Londoners at the most impressive St Patrick’s Day Festival London has ever seen. In these unsettling times our sense of social cohesion is being tested like never before. With our new social integration strategy, we’re taking action to build a stronger sense of unity within our city https://t.co/Sc6IjwrltV

This @KingsCollegeLon report makes it clear that retreating from the international economy would harm the entire country. More than 100,000 Londoners work in manufacturing, contributing billions to our capital’s economy. I’m proud to join @GMB_Union members and show my support for their excellent manufacturing campaign. https://t.co/7xbaJtLKAa #makingit

Professor Stephen Hawking not only opened up the secrets of the universe to millions, he lived life with a grace and determination that set an example to all of us. He will be forever remembered and greatly missed https://t.co/CffW67dEY9

It’s vital we have a policing and criminal justice system that serves and protects everyone, regardless of their ethnicity or background. We are working tirelessly with @MetPoliceUK and other partners to improve the issues of disproportionality among these communities

It’s unacceptable that a disproportionate number of BAME individuals come into contact with our police and criminal justice system, particularly as victims of crime. Today, @SophieKLinden is holding a public meeting to discuss how we can tackle this issue https://t.co/V9TJTD6a3s

The judicial review of the decision to free John Worboys begins today. Londoners’ safety is my top priority – that’s why, on behalf of the victims and survivors of this convicted rapist, I felt I had to be involved in challenging the Parole Board decision. https://t.co/tEmqoCOciB

In London we're putting affordable housing first and beginning to turn things round. But we'll only truly fix the housing crisis with more government investment, far greater powers to free up land, and changes so councils and mayors can build much more. https://t.co/GwXOGqBVxA

We cannot & should not slow down tech innovation - but we can no longer ignore some of the more harmful effects created by the scale & pace of change. It's time for governments & companies to work together to shape the future of tech so that it works for everyone. #SXSW https://t.co/ow0oit6Sd9
